meanings.definition: To cause to adhere in a single mass.
meanings.sent1: Mixing the ingredients well will result in agglutinating them into a dough.
meanings.sent2: The glue was agglutinating the broken pieces of the vase together.
meanings.sent3: The spilled honey was agglutinating the ants into a sticky mess.
meanings.sent4: Her words had a way of agglutinating the group into a unified team.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brushstrokes seemed to agglutinate the colors into a vibrant masterpiece.

meanings.definition: To form words by combining morphemes without changing them.
meanings.sent1: In English, we often create new words by agglutinating different parts together.
meanings.sent2: The language allows for agglutinating prefixes and suffixes to the root word.
meanings.sent3: The playful child enjoyed agglutinating silly sounds to make up imaginary words.
meanings.sent4: Her storytelling had a way of agglutinating emotions into vivid imagery.
meanings.sent5: The chef's recipe involved agglutinating various flavors to create a unique dish.
